content:
The provided code snippet is part of a method responsible for setting up and configuring a user interface element (a menubutton) related to managing "force groups" in a particle effect configuration tool. The code creates a labeled menu button (`self. forceGroupLabel`) with an associated dropdown menu (`self.forceGroupLabelMenu`), which allows users to either select an existing force group or create a new one. This is part of a larger particle effects management system, likely used in a graphical application or game development context, where forces can be applied to control the behavior of particles (e.g., creating explosions, rain, snow, etc.).

menu = self.particlesEnableMenu)
        self.particlesLabelMenu.add_separator()
        # Current force
        self.forceGroupLabel = tk.Menubutton(labelFrame, width = 10,
                                             relief = tk.RAISED,
                                             borderwidth = 2,
                                             font=('MSSansSerif', 12, 'bold'),
                                             activebackground = '#909090')
        self.forceGroupLabelMenu = tk.Menu(self.forceGroupLabel, tearoff = 0)
        self.forceGroupLabel['menu'] = self.forceGroupLabelMenu
        self.forceGroupLabel.pack(side = tk.LEFT, fill = 'x', expand = 1)
        self.bind(self.forceGroupLabel,
                  ('Select force group to configure ' +
                   'or add a new force group to current effect'))
        self.forceGroupLabelMenu.add_command(
            label = 'Create New ForceGroup',
